Openness.description: Openness to experience. Higher: Intellectually curious, emotionally-aware, sensitive to beauty and willing to try new things.\nLower: Preferring the plain, straightforward, and obvious over the complex, ambiguous, and subtle.

Adventurousness.description: Eagerness to trying new activities and experiencing new things.

info.summary: This is one of the six facets in the B5 Model. It consists the traits such as Altruism & Morality etc
info.general: This facet averages its individual traits and is generally an indication of a person's tendency to be compassionate and cooperative toward others.
info.high: Value getting along with others. They have a more optimistic view of human nature.
info.low: Value self interests over others. They are more skeptical of others' motives.

Artistic-interests.description: Appreciation for art and beauty, both man-made and in nature.

Conscientiousness.description: Higher: More self-disciplined, dutiful, or aiming for achievement against measures or outside expectations.\nLower: More likely to prefer the spontaneous over the planned.

Gregariousness.description: Fondness for the company of others; sociability.

info.summary: This is one of the six facets in the B5 Model. It consists the traits such as Altruism & Morality etc

description.high: Value getting along with others. You have a more optimistic view of human nature.
description.low: Value self interests over others. You are more skeptical of others' motives.

Agreeableness.summary: This facet averages its individual traits and is generally an indication of a person's tendency to be compassionate and cooperative toward others.

Altruism.description: Active and genuine concern for the welfare of others.

info.high: Find that helping others is genuinely rewarding, that doing things for others is a form of self-fulfilment rather than self-sacrifice.
info.low: More concerned with taking care of her/himself than taking time for others. Not necessarily selfish, but believing other people are capable of taking care of themselves, so only mind his or her own business. When asked, depends on other traits, the person may be actually more than willing to help.

Cooperation.description: Dislike of confrontations. Responding to interpersonal conflict with a willingness to compromise.

info.high: You're easy to please and try to avoid confrontation, you add harmony to any type of relationship.
info.low: You do not shy away from contradicting others, if others happen to have the same trait, you may argue with them a lot.

Modesty.description: Tendency to be unassuming and play down own achievements; humility.

info.high: Uncomfortable being the center of attention, yet not necessarily lacks self-confidence or self-esteem.
info.low: This person holds herself or himself in high regard and is satisfied with who s/he is.

Morality.description: Tendency to see need for pretense or manipulation when dealing with others and are therefore whether is candid, frank, and genuine. Impact to relationship from this trait is hard to predict - there is an intricate and complex connection between morality and personal relationships.

info.high: This person tend to think it is wrong to take advantage of others to get ahead.
info.low: Comfortable using every trick in the book to get what she/he want.

Sympathy.description: Attitude of compassion for others; kindness.

info.high: This person feels what others feel and are compassionate toward them.
info.low: This person thinks people should generally rely more on themselves than on others.

Trust.description: Level of belief in the sincerity and good intentions of others.

info.high: This person believes the best of others and trust people easily.
info.low: This person is wary of other people's intentions and do not trust easily

Neuroticism.description: Also referred to as Emotional Range or Natural Reactions, is the extent to which a person's emotions are sensitive to the individual's environment.
